page.title: 13Job Survey
page.content: The basic industries of our area are coal mining and farming. However these 2 industries account for only 5% of all jobs. Most people are connected with the Port of Dover. Over 65% of these people are employed with the Cross Ferry Companies (Townsed's, Sealink), HM Customs (immigration & cutoms) or as import/export clerks with the many shipping companies in the town. Most of the remaining 30% are also 'service' industries, ie nursing, hairdressing, shop assistants, civil servants, secretarial and receptionist work. Only 2% of all the people interviewed were self-employed and these were either painters and decorators or general builders. None of the interviewed actually worked in Whitfield itself. We therfore conclude that the village is basically a "dormitory". We found very little evidence of unemployment.
